text: Using hsb data, test whether average write differs significantly 50.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: paired (samples) t-test used want compare means two related groups observations continuous dependent variable. paired sample test, subject entity measured twice. can used evaluate effectiveness training programs treatments. dependent variable dichotomous, use McNemar test.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Using hsb data, test whether mean read equal mean write.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: independent samples t-test used compare means normally distributed continuous dependent variable two unrelated groups. dependent variable must approximately normally distributed cases/subjects two groups must different .e.Â subject one group also subject group. can used answer whether: average number products produced two machines differ significantly? average salaries graduate students differ based gender?

text: Two sample test proportion performs tests equality proportions using large-sample statistics. tests categorical variable proportion within two groups two variables proportion.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Using treatment data, test equality proportion two treatments
code: # Using Variables ifr_ts_prop_test(treatment, treatment1, treatment2, alternative = 'all') ##        Test Statistics         ## ----------------------------- ## Total Observations        100  ## z                       0.403  ## Pr(|Z| < |z|)           0.687  ## Pr(Z < z)               0.656  ## Pr(Z > z)               0.344

text: Using treatment2 data, test whether outcome proportion male female

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Test whether proportion people two batches pass review exam training program. first batch 30 participants, 30% passed review, whereas second batch 25 participants, 50% passed review.
code: # Calculator ifr_ts_prop_calc(n1 = 30, n2 = 25, p1 = 0.3, p2 = 0.5, alternative = 'all') ##        Test Statistics          ## ------------------------------ ## Total Observations          55  ## z                       -1.514  ## Pr(|Z| < |z|)             0.13  ## Pr(Z < z)                0.065  ## Pr(Z > z)                0.935

title: Introduction to inferr
text: One sample variance comparison test compares standard deviation (variances) hypothesized value. determines whether standard deviation population equal hypothesized value. can used answer following questions: variance equal pre-determined threshold value? variance greater pre-determined threshold value? variance less pre-determined threshold value?

what: Chi Square Goodness of Fit Test
title: Introduction to inferr
text: chi-square goodness fit test allows us compare observed sample distribution expected probability distribution. tests whether observed proportions categorical variable differ hypothesized proportions. proportion cases expected group categorical variable may equal unequal. can applied univariate distribution can calculate cumulative distribution function. applied binned data value chi square test depends data binned. chi square approximation valid, sample size must sufficiently large.

previous_headings: Chi Square Goodness of Fit Test
title: Introduction to inferr
text: Using hsb data, test whether observed proportions race differs significantly hypothesized proportions.

previous_headings: Chi Square Goodness of Fit Test > Example
title: Introduction to inferr
Introduction to inferr
text: chi-square test used want test significant relationship two nominal (categorical) variables.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Using hsb data, test relationship type school attended (schtyp) studentsâ gender (female). Using hsb data, test relationship type school attended (schtyp) studentsâ socio economic status (ses).
code: ifr_chisq_assoc_test(hsb, female, schtyp) ##                Chi Square Statistics                  ##  ## Statistics                     DF    Value      Prob  ## ---------------------------------------------------- ## Chi-Square                     1    0.0470    0.8284 ## Likelihood Ratio Chi-Square    1    0.0471    0.8282 ## Continuity Adj. Chi-Square     1    0.0005    0.9822 ## Mantel-Haenszel Chi-Square     1    0.0468    0.8287 ## Phi Coefficient                     0.0153           ## Contingency Coefficient             0.0153           ## Cramer's V                          0.0153           ## ---------------------------------------------------- ifr_chisq_assoc_test(hsb, schtyp, ses) ##                Chi Square Statistics                  ##  ## Statistics                     DF    Value      Prob  ## ---------------------------------------------------- ## Chi-Square                     2    6.3342    0.0421 ## Likelihood Ratio Chi-Square    2    7.9060    0.0192 ## Phi Coefficient                     0.1780           ## Contingency Coefficient             0.1752           ## Cramer's V                          0.1780           ## ----------------------------------------------------

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Leveneâs test used determine k samples equal variances. less sensitive departures normality alternative Bartlettâs test. test returns Leveneâs robust test statistic two statistics proposed Brown Forsythe replace mean Leveneâs formula alternative location estimators. first alternative replaces mean median second alternative replaces mean 10% trimmed mean.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Using hsb data, test whether variance reading score across race.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Using hsb data, test whether variance equal reading, writing social studies scores.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Cochranâs Q test extension McNemar test related samples provides method testing differences three matched sets frequencies proportions. procedure testing proportions 3 dichotomous variables equal population. outcome variables measured people statistical units.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: exam data set contains scores 15 students three exams (exam1, exam2, exam3). Test three exams equally difficult.
code: ifr_cochran_qtest(exam, exam1, exam2, exam3) ##    Test Statistics      ## ---------------------- ## N                   15  ## Cochran's Q       4.75  ## df                   2  ## p value          0.093  ## ----------------------

title: Introduction to inferr
text: McNemar test non parametric test created Quinn McNemar first published Psychometrika 1947. similar paired t test applied dichotomous dependent variable. used test statistically significant change proportions occurred dichotomous trait two time points population. can used answer whether: two products equally appealing? proportion success vs failure significantly change treatment? proportion voters significantly change prior following significant political development?

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Using hsb data, test proportion students himath hiread group equal. Perform test using matrix input.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: Runs Test can used decide data set random process. tests whether observations sequence serially independent .e.Â whether occur random order counting many runs threshold. run defined series increasing values series decreasing values. number increasing, decreasing, values length run. default, median used threshold. small number runs indicates positive serial correlation; large number indicates negative serial correlation.

title: Introduction to inferr
text: use runs test check regression residuals serial correlation.
code: # basic example ifr_runs_test(hsb, read) ## Runs Test ##  Total Cases:  200  ##  Test Value :  50  ##  Cases < Test Value:  101  ##  Cases > Test Value:  99  ##  Number of Runs:  95  ##  Expected Runs:  100.99  ##  Variance (Runs):  49.73874  ##  z Statistic:  -0.8493358  ##  p-value:  0.3956945 # drop values equal to threshold ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, drop = TRUE) ## Runs Test ##  Total Cases:  200  ##  Test Value :  50  ##  Cases < Test Value:  83  ##  Cases > Test Value:  99  ##  Number of Runs:  89  ##  Expected Runs:  91.2967  ##  Variance (Runs):  44.54805  ##  z Statistic:  -0.3441046  ##  p-value:  0.7307676 # recode data in binary format ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, split = TRUE) ## Runs Test ##  Total Cases:  200  ##  Test Value :  50  ##  Cases < Test Value:  101  ##  Cases > Test Value:  99  ##  Number of Runs:  95  ##  Expected Runs:  100.99  ##  Variance (Runs):  49.73874  ##  z Statistic:  -0.8493358  ##  p-value:  0.3956945 # use mean as threshold ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, mean = TRUE) ## Runs Test ##  Total Cases:  200  ##  Test Value :  52.23  ##  Cases < Test Value:  115  ##  Cases > Test Value:  85  ##  Number of Runs:  93  ##  Expected Runs:  98.75  ##  Variance (Runs):  47.52418  ##  z Statistic:  -0.8340854  ##  p-value:  0.4042329 # threshold to be used for counting runs ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, threshold = 0) ## Runs Test ##  Total Cases:  200  ##  Test Value :  0  ##  Cases < Test Value:  0  ##  Cases > Test Value:  200  ##  Number of Runs:  1  ##  Expected Runs:  1  ##  Variance (Runs):  0  ##  z Statistic:  NaN  ##  p-value:  NaN

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing othersâ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement hebbali.aravind@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozillaâs code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Inferential Statistics
text: Tools Statistical Inference

title: Inferential Statistics
text: inferr builds upon statistical tests provided stats, provides additional flexible input options detailed structured test results. version 0.3, inferr includes select set parametric non-parametric statistical tests listed : One Sample t Test Paired Sample t Test Independent Sample t Test One Sample Proportion Test Two Sample Proportion Test One Sample Variance Test Two Sample Variance Test Binomial Test ANOVA Chi Square Goodness Fit Test Chi Square Independence Test Leveneâs Test Cochranâs Q Test McNemar Test Runs Test Randomness

title: Inferential Statistics
code: # install inferr from CRAN install.packages("inferr")  # the development version from github # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("rsquaredacademy/inferr")

title: Inferential Statistics
text: Introduction inferr

title: Inferential Statistics
code: ifr_chisq_assoc_test(hsb, female, schtyp) #>                Chi Square Statistics                  #>  #> Statistics                     DF    Value      Prob  #> ---------------------------------------------------- #> Chi-Square                     1    0.0470    0.8284 #> Likelihood Ratio Chi-Square    1    0.0471    0.8282 #> Continuity Adj. Chi-Square     1    0.0005    0.9822 #> Mantel-Haenszel Chi-Square     1    0.0468    0.8287 #> Phi Coefficient                     0.0153           #> Contingency Coefficient             0.0153           #> Cramer's V                          0.0153           #> ----------------------------------------------------

title: Binomial Test â ifr_binom_calc
text: Test whether proportion successes two-level categorical dependent variable significantly differs hypothesized value.

title: Binomial Test â ifr_binom_calc
code: ifr_binom_calc(n, success, prob = 0.5, ...)  ifr_binom_test(data, variable, prob = 0.5)

title: Binomial Test â ifr_binom_calc
text: n number observations success number successes prob assumed probability success trial ... additional arguments passed methods data data.frame tibble variable factor; column data

title: Binomial Test â ifr_binom_calc
text: ifr_binom_test returns object class "ifr_binom_test". object class "ifr_binom_test" list containing following components: exp_k expected number successes exp_p expected probability success k number successes n number observations obs_p assumed probability success pval_lower lower one sided p value pval_upper upper one sided p value

title: Binomial Test â ifr_binom_calc
text: infer_binom_calc() infer_binom_test() deprecated. Instead use ifr_binom_cal() ifr_binom_test().

title: Binomial Test â ifr_binom_calc
text: Hoel, P. G. 1984. Introduction Mathematical Statistics. 5th ed. New York: Wiley.

what: Chi Square Test of Association â ifr_chisq_assoc_test

text: Chi Square test association examine relationship two categorical variables.

title: Chi Square Test of Association â ifr_chisq_assoc_test
Chi Square Test of Association â ifr_chisq_assoc_test
text: data data.frame tibble x factor; column data y factor; column data

title: Chi Square Test of Association â ifr_chisq_assoc_test
text: ifr_chisq_assoc_test returns object class "ifr_chisq_assoc_test". object class "ifr_chisq_assoc_test" list containing following components: chisquare chi square chisquare_lr likelihood ratio chi square chisquare_mantel_haenszel mantel haenszel chi square chisquare_adjusted continuity adjusted chi square contingency_coefficient contingency coefficient cramers_v cramer's v df degrees freedom ds product dimensions table x y phi_coefficient phi coefficient pval_chisquare p-value chi square pval_chisquare_adjusted p-value continuity adjusted chi square pval_chisquare_lr p-value likelihood ratio chi square pval_chisquare_mantel_haenszel p-value mantel haenszel chi square

title: Chi Square Test of Association â ifr_chisq_assoc_test
text: infer_chisq_assoc_test() deprecated. Instead use ifr_chisq_assoc_test().

title: Chi Square Test of Association â ifr_chisq_assoc_test
text: Sheskin, D. J. 2007. Handbook Parametric Nonparametric Statistical Procedures, 4th edition. : Chapman & Hall/CRC.

code: ifr_chisq_assoc_test(hsb, female, schtyp) #>                Chi Square Statistics                  #>  #> Statistics                     DF    Value      Prob  #> ---------------------------------------------------- #> Chi-Square                     1    0.0470    0.8284 #> Likelihood Ratio Chi-Square    1    0.0471    0.8282 #> Continuity Adj. Chi-Square     1    0.0005    0.9822 #> Mantel-Haenszel Chi-Square     1    0.0468    0.8287 #> Phi Coefficient                     0.0153           #> Contingency Coefficient             0.0153           #> Cramer's V                          0.0153           #> ----------------------------------------------------  ifr_chisq_assoc_test(hsb, female, ses) #>                Chi Square Statistics                  #>  #> Statistics                     DF    Value      Prob  #> ---------------------------------------------------- #> Chi-Square                     2    4.5765    0.1014 #> Likelihood Ratio Chi-Square    2    4.6789    0.0964 #> Phi Coefficient                     0.1513           #> Contingency Coefficient             0.1496           #> Cramer's V                          0.1513           #> ----------------------------------------------------

what: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test
title: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test
text: ifr_levene_test reports Levene's robust test statistic equality variances two statistics proposed Brown Forsythe replace mean Levene's formula alternative location estimators. first alternative replaces mean median. second alternative replaces mean 10

title: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test
code: ifr_levene_test(data, ...)  # Default S3 method ifr_levene_test(data, ..., group_var = NULL, trim_mean = 0.1)

title: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test
text: data data.frame tibble ... numeric; columns data group_var factor; column data trim_mean trimmed mean

title: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test
text: ifr_levene_test returns object class "ifr_levene_test". object class "ifr_levene_test" list containing following components: bf Brown Forsythe f statistic p_bf p-value Brown Forsythe f statistic lev Levene's f statistic p_lev p-value Levene's f statistic bft Brown Forsythe f statistic using trimmed mean p_bft p-value Brown Forsythe f statistic using trimmed mean avgs mean level grouping variable sds standard deviations level grouping variable avg combined mean sd combined standard deviation n number observations n_df numerator degrees freedom d_df denominator degrees freedom levs levels grouping variable lens number observations level grouping variable type alternative hypothesis

title: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test
text: infer_levene_test() deprecated. Instead use ifr_levene_test().

title: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test
text: Bland, M. 2000. Introduction Medical Statistics. 3rd ed. Oxford: Oxford University Press. Brown, M. B., . B. Forsythe. 1974. Robust tests equality variances. Journal American Statistical Association 69: 364â367. Carroll, R. J., H. Schneider. 1985. note Leveneâs tests equality variances. Statistics Probability Letters 3: 191â194.

title: Levene's test for equality of variances â ifr_levene_test

title: McNemar Test â ifr_mcnemar_test
text: data data.frame tibble x factor; column data y factor; column data

title: McNemar Test â ifr_mcnemar_test
text: ifr_mcnemar_test returns object class "ifr_mcnemar_test". object class "ifr_mcnemar_test" list containing following components: statistic chi square statistic df degrees freedom pvalue p-value exactp exact p-value cstat continuity correction chi square statistic cpvalue continuity correction p-value kappa kappa coefficient; measure interrater agreement std_err asymptotic standard error kappa_cil 95% kappa lower confidence limit kappa_ciu 95% kappa upper confidence limit cases cases controls controls ratio ratio proportion factor odratio odds ratio tbl two way table

title: McNemar Test â ifr_mcnemar_test
text: infer_mcnermar_test() deprecated. Instead use ifr_mcnemar_test().

title: One Way ANOVA â ifr_oneway_anova
text: ifr_oneway_anova returns object class "ifr_oneway_anova". object class "ifr_oneway_anova" list containing following components: adjusted_r2 adjusted r squared value df_btw groups degress freedom df_within within groups degress freedom df_total total degress freedom fstat f value group_stats group statistics ms_btw groups mean square ms_within within groups mean square obs number observations pval p value r2 r squared value rmse root mean squared error ss_between group sum squares ss_within within group sum squares ss_total total sum squares

what: One Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_os_prop_test
title: One Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_os_prop_test
text: ifr_os_prop_test compares proportion one group specified population proportion.

title: One Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_os_prop_test
code: ifr_os_prop_test(   data,   variable = NULL,   prob = 0.5,   phat = 0.5,   alternative = c("both", "less", "greater", "all") )  # Default S3 method ifr_os_prop_test(   data,   variable = NULL,   prob = 0.5,   phat = 0.5,   alternative = c("both", "less", "greater", "all") )

what: One Sample t Test â ifr_os_t_test

text: ifr_os_t_test performs t tests equality means. tests hypothesis sample mean equal hypothesized value.

title: One Sample t Test â ifr_os_t_test

title: One Sample t Test â ifr_os_t_test
text: data data.frame tibble x numeric; column data mu number indicating true value mean alpha acceptable tolerance type error alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis, must one "" (default), "greater", "less" "". can specify just initial letter ... additional arguments passed methods

title: One Sample t Test â ifr_os_t_test

what: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
title: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
text: runtest tests whether observations x serially independent .e. whether occur random order, counting many runs threshold.  default, median used threshold.  small number runs indicates positive serial correlation; large number indicates negative serial correlation.

title: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
code: ifr_runs_test(   data,   x,   drop = FALSE,   split = FALSE,   mean = FALSE,   threshold = NA )

title: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
text: data data.frame tibble x numeric; column data drop logical; TRUE, values equal threshold dropped x split logical; TRUE, data recoded binary format mean logical; TRUE, mean used threshold threshold threshold used counting runs, specify 0 data coded binary.

title: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
text: infer_runs_test returns object class "ifr_runs_test". object class "ifr_runs_test" list containing following components: n number observations threshold within group sum squares n_below number threshold n_above number threshold mean expected number runs var variance number runs n_runs number runs z z statistic p p-value z

title: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
text: runs_test() deprecated. Instead use ifr_runs_test().

title: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
text: Sheskin, D. J. 2007. Handbook Parametric Nonparametric Statistical Procedures, 4th edition. : Chapman & Hall/CRC. Edgington, E. S. 1961. Probability table number runs signs first differences ordered series. Journal American Statistical Association 56: 156â159. Madansky, . 1988. Prescriptions Working Statisticians. New York: Springer. Swed, F. S., C. Eisenhart. 1943. Tables testing randomness grouping sequence alternatives. Annals Mathematical Statistics 14: 66â87.

title: Test for Random Order â ifr_runs_test
code: ifr_runs_test(hsb, read) #> Runs Test #>  Total Cases:  200  #>  Test Value :  50  #>  Cases < Test Value:  101  #>  Cases > Test Value:  99  #>  Number of Runs:  95  #>  Expected Runs:  100.99  #>  Variance (Runs):  49.73874  #>  z Statistic:  -0.8493358  #>  p-value:  0.3956945   ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, drop = TRUE) #> Runs Test #>  Total Cases:  200  #>  Test Value :  50  #>  Cases < Test Value:  83  #>  Cases > Test Value:  99  #>  Number of Runs:  89  #>  Expected Runs:  91.2967  #>  Variance (Runs):  44.54805  #>  z Statistic:  -0.3441046  #>  p-value:  0.7307676   ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, split = TRUE) #> Runs Test #>  Total Cases:  200  #>  Test Value :  50  #>  Cases < Test Value:  101  #>  Cases > Test Value:  99  #>  Number of Runs:  95  #>  Expected Runs:  100.99  #>  Variance (Runs):  49.73874  #>  z Statistic:  -0.8493358  #>  p-value:  0.3956945   ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, mean = TRUE) #> Runs Test #>  Total Cases:  200  #>  Test Value :  52.23  #>  Cases < Test Value:  115  #>  Cases > Test Value:  85  #>  Number of Runs:  93  #>  Expected Runs:  98.75  #>  Variance (Runs):  47.52418  #>  z Statistic:  -0.8340854  #>  p-value:  0.4042329   ifr_runs_test(hsb, read, threshold = 0) #> Runs Test #>  Total Cases:  200  #>  Test Value :  0  #>  Cases < Test Value:  0  #>  Cases > Test Value:  200  #>  Number of Runs:  1  #>  Expected Runs:  1  #>  Variance (Runs):  0  #>  z Statistic:  NaN  #>  p-value:  NaN

what: Two Independent Sample t Test â ifr_ts_ind_ttest
title: Two Independent Sample t Test â ifr_ts_ind_ttest
text: ifr_ts_ind_ttest compares means two independent groups order determine whether statistical evidence associated population means significantly different.

title: Two Independent Sample t Test â ifr_ts_ind_ttest
code: ifr_ts_ind_ttest(   data,   x,   y,   confint = 0.95,   alternative = c("both", "less", "greater", "all"),   ... )

title: Two Independent Sample t Test â ifr_ts_ind_ttest
text: data data frame x factor; column data y numeric; column data confint confidence level alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis, must one "" (default), "greater", "less" "". can specify just initial letter ... additional arguments passed methods

title: Two Independent Sample t Test â ifr_ts_ind_ttest
text: ifr_ts_ind_ttest returns object class "ifr_ts_ind_ttest". object class "ifr_ts_ind_ttest" list containing following components: levels levels x obs number observations y level x n total number observations mean mean y level x sd standard deviation y level x se estimate standard error y level x lower lower limit mean y level x upper upper limit mean y level x combined data frame; mean, standard deviation, standard error confidence limit mean y mean_diff difference mean y two groups x se_dif estimate standard error difference mean y two groups x sd_dif degrees freedom conf_diff confidence interval mean_diff df_pooled degrees freedom pooled method df_satterthwaite degrees freedom Satterthwaite method t_pooled t statistic pooled method t_satterthwaite t statistic Satterthwaite method sig_pooled two-sided p-value pooled method sig_pooled_l lower one-sided p-value pooled method sig_pooled_u upper one-sided p-value pooled method sig two-sided p-value Satterthwaite method sig_l lower one-sided p-value Satterthwaite method sig_u upper one-sided p-value Satterthwaite method num_df numerator degrees freedom folded f test den_df denominator degrees freedom folded f test f f value equality variances test f_sig p-value folded f test var_y name y confint confidence level alternative alternative hypothesis

text: data data.frame tibble x numeric; column data y numeric; column data confint confidence level alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis, must one "" (default), "greater", "less" "". can specify just initial letter.

title: Paired t test â ifr_ts_paired_ttest
text: ifr_ts_paired_ttest returns object class "ifr_ts_paired_ttest". object class "ifr_ts_paired_ttest" list containing following components: Obs number observations b mean, standard deviation standard error x, y difference tstat t statistic p_lower lower one-sided p-value p_upper upper one-sided p-value p_two_tail two sided p-value corr Correlation x y corsig p-value correlation test conf_int1 confidence interval mean x conf_int2 confidence interval mean y conf_int_diff confidence interval mean difference x y df degrees freedom confint confidence level alternative alternative hypothesis var_names names x y xy string used printing results test

what: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
title: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
text: Tests equality proportions using large-sample statistics. tests sample proportion within two independent groups two samples proportion.

title: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
code: ifr_ts_prop_test(   data,   var1,   var2,   alternative = c("both", "less", "greater", "all"),   ... )  ifr_ts_prop_group(   data,   var,   group,   alternative = c("both", "less", "greater", "all") )  ifr_ts_prop_calc(   n1,   n2,   p1,   p2,   alternative = c("both", "less", "greater", "all"),   ... )

title: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
text: data data.frame tibble var1 factor; column data var2 factor; column data alternative character string specifying alternative hypothesis, must one "" (default), "greater", "less" "". can specify just initial letter ... additional arguments passed methods var factor; column data group factor; column data n1 sample 1 size n2 sample 2 size p1 sample 1 proportion p2 sample 2 proportion

title: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
text: object class "ifr_ts_prop_test". object class "ifr_ts_prop_test" list containing following components: n1 sample 1 size n2 sample 2 size phat1 sample 1 proportion phat2 sample 2 proportion z z statistic sig p-value z statistic alt alternative hypothesis

title: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
text: infer_ts_prop_test(), infer_ts_prop_grp() infer_ts_prop_calc() deprecated. Instead use ifr_ts_prop_test(), ifr_ts_prop_group() ifr_ts_prop_calc().

title: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
text: Sheskin, D. J. 2007. Handbook Parametric Nonparametric Statistical Procedures, 4th edition. : Chapman & Hall/CRC.

title: Two Sample Test of Proportion â ifr_ts_prop_test
code: # using variables # lower tail ifr_ts_prop_test(treatment, treatment1, treatment2, alternative = 'less') #>        Test Statistics         #> ----------------------------- #> Total Observations        100  #> z                       0.403  #> Pr(Z < z)               0.656  #>   # using groups # lower tail ifr_ts_prop_group(treatment2, outcome, female, alternative = 'less') #>        Test Statistics         #> ----------------------------- #> Total Observations        200  #> z                       0.351  #> Pr(Z < z)               0.637  #>   # using sample size and proportions # lower tail ifr_ts_prop_calc(n1 = 30, n2 = 25, p1 = 0.3, p2 = 0.5, alternative = 'less') #>        Test Statistics          #> ------------------------------ #> Total Observations          55  #> z                       -1.514  #> Pr(Z < z)                0.065  #>

title: inferr 0.1.1
text: binom_test() accepts non-binary variables (#1). ind_ttest() throw error grouping variable 2 levels (#2). ts_prop_test() accept binary variables (#3). var_test() accept binary variables group_var input. number continuous variables must also exceed two. (#4).
